page.title: 14THE LIFE OF A VICAR. cont.
page.content: A vicar's job is a very difficult one. All the churches are in need of some repair. Every Christian member of the church is obliged to give a certain amount of their income and this is given through a weekly envelope scheme. Outsiders also contribute by attending the Autumn Fayre, whist drives, concerts, coffee evenings and so on. In 1985 the budget for the Parish is Â£12,000. Each week the vicar has to write a sermon for the Sunday service. This involves a lot of work. Most of the services have Readings which are set for the day so usually the theme is taken from that. Sometimes someone will say something to Mr. Jones and that triggers off a thought for his sermon.
